graphics.utilities

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphics.utilities.Camera

  • public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
    Imaginary camera to navigate 3D world.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    OSM Group 5 - DollyWood project

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f position,
      org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f rotation,
      float fov,
      float zNear,
      float zFar)
        Parameters:
        position - Camera position
        rotation - Camera rotation
        fov - Field of View angle from center point to upper edge point. Horizontal fov specified by Globals screen size; Globals.screenHeight and Globals.screenWidth.
        zNear - Objects closer to the camera than zNear not visible, zNear >= 0.
        zFar - Objects further away from camera than zFar not visible, zNear >= 0.

    • Method Detail

      • processInput

        public void processInput(float speedModifier)
        Takes input from keyboard and mouse and changes the cameras position and rotation acordingly.
        W = forward
        S = backward
        A = left
        D = right
        All the above movements are in x/y coordinates and depend on where the camera i looking
        Left_Shift = down
        Space = up
        note that up/down only changes z position, and is unaffected by camera rotation
        lastly the rotation of the camera is set by mouse DX/DY movement
        Parameters:
        speedModifier - sets how much the cameras position should change

      • applyTranslations

        public void applyTranslations()
        Changes simulated camera position and rotation.

      • applyPerspective

        public void applyPerspective()
        Set perspective view to the world, if not run orthographic view will be used.


        Top right object is in perspective view.

      • getPosition

        public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f getPosition()
        Returns:
        The current position vector of the camera

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f position)
        Sets the position of the camera. Note that the camera won't move unless you call applyTranslations() afterwards
        Parameters:
        position - The new position of the camera
